Hi,
I'm trying to run Heritrix 1.12.0 on a PC with Windows Xp PROFESSIONAL
=
SP2, but unsuccesfully. I've already widely used the same version on
Win XP=
 HOME EDITION, but I don't remember any problem in
configuration. I only re=
member I've replaced the jmxremote.password
where need and replaced @PASSWO=
RD@ with letmein in those file.

When I try, from command line, to launch h=
eritrix in this way, the
output is like the follow lines:

>- Login and pas=
sword have not been specified (see --admin switch)
>- another program uses =
the port for the web UI (8080 by default)
 (e.g. another Heritrix instance)=

>- JMX password file is missing or permissions not set correctly

>Do you =
want to try to fix the permissions (Y/N)?

When I choose Y, it returns this=
 second set of output:

>Restart Heritrix (Y/N)?Y
>WARNING: It's currently =
not possible to run Heritrix in background  
     >on Windows. It was just =
started minimized in a new Window and
will be >shut down as soon as you log=
 off.

>Either fixing the permissions failed or there was another problem.
=
>You may have to set the ownership of the file 
>\Programmi\Java\heritrix-1=
.12.0\jmxremote.password
>manually to yourself (%USERNAME%) and restrict th=
e access to >read-only.

where %USERNAME% is my username in windows account=
.

I've read the FAQ and all the correlated articles
(http://www.cip.ifi.lm=
u.de/~schoefma/howto/run_heritrix_on_windows/
for example).

I also tried t=
o modify permission in all the way. 
What's wrong? Please help me!

Thanks
=
xdelox
